name: Hotel Bellevue Dubrovnik

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My only regret after spending 2 nights at the hotel is that I should have stayed longer!
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: On first arrival, in the middle of a thunderstorm at around 6:30pm on a cool November evening, I was most delighted to find that the hotel was conveniently located steps from the bus-stop (#1A or 1B from the bus station where intercity buses and airport bus drop people off). The economy room w/o balcony we checked-in on the 3rd floor has great view of the coast, is very quiet and has everything you would normally ask for from a 5-star. At this rate (below 100 euro per night low season) I think this is one of the best deals one could expect of a hotel of this class.
reviews.title: Excellent service, beautiful setting, great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (On first check-in, 2 lights and the heating of towel hanger in the bathroom were not working. When told, the reception almost immediately sent someone to fix them. Very efficient indeed.)
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of the poor weather, we stayed to dine at Vapor. (To be honest we did not plan to.) We did not regret it. We have ordered the fixed menu (of 400 kunas) and a grilled scampi. Both in terms of the quality and quantity this meal far exceeded our expectation. Pure gastronomic delight. Breakfast is great too but I would prefer more choices.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with a helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid a visit to the spa and pool. They look absoluely fantastic. Overall the hotel is a top-notched one. Yes, it takes around 15 minutes on foot to Pile Gate, but I would still strongly recommend. This is one of our hotel experience.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel - a week in Dubrovnik possibly too long though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite location yet within easy walking distance of old town (mostly downhill when going from hotel). Bus stop just outside for the return journey. Frequent buses. Very courteous staff. Small pebble beach area with restaurant.
reviews.title: Clean 5 star hotel ideally located for 10 min easy walk to old city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a tasteful, modern luxury hotel with some charm, located about a 15 min walk to old town and with a private beach and lovely ocean view (no view of old town). Indoor pool, whirlpool, sauna, steam room; great buffet breakfast, restaurant on-site. Room was small but well appointed and with that terrific sea view & windows that open. We got a good price online in the off season so for us it was good value. Great, helpful concierge. For a 5 star hotel there were a few niggly service issues - desk staff didn't know telephone charges for longdistance calling, turndown service missed one night with no explanation, housekeeping in our room was a bit lax generally. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay again if a good price was available, but would not pay high season list prices for this hotel.
reviews.title: view, location, good off-season value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have visted the beautiful Bellevue on three occasions and simply adore it. Boris and the team could not have made us more welcome. The service is beyond compare. The suite I stayed in was beautiful, ultra modern and chic - adn the view is to die for. Croatia is my new favourite place. I took 12 guests with me and they all fell in love with the palce. And the food...where to start? Mouth watering. I can't wait to go back
reviews.title: Chic, beautiful perfection
Dreamy
reviews.text: Perfectly positioned for a quick walk to the old town, but far enough out so not to be battling through crowds of tourists. Rooms on cliff edge looking over their own private beach, great restaurant and bar... the most comfortable bed for the entire trip... would recommend to anyone and everyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 10 nights at this hotel and really enjoyed it. The service was excellent, the rooms nice but perhaps on the small side,but the best thing apart from the view was the food in the Vapour restaurant, it was the best we had in Dubrovnik by a long way, expensive by Croatian standards but worth it. TV selection could be better, you get fed up with world new in 4 different languages. The walk into the old city according to the brochure is 800mt it is in fact 1500mt. Certainly helps you build up an appetite.
reviews.title: Best Food in Dubrovnik

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our 3 day stay here. Excellent rooms with balcony and very private. The whole hotel is beautifully decorated and very clean. Being built into a cliff gives great views out to sea. We were worried it was too far from the old town but it's a 15 minute walk and there are lots of cheap buses too so the location was perfect. Staff were helpful and friendly. If I go back to Dubrovnik I would certainly revisit this hotel!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you go expecting a 5 star hotel, you may be disappointed, depending on your previous travel experience and expectations. If you go and expect a 4 star hotel you will get what you pay for. Rooms are clean and reasonably spacious, staff is quite friendly, and the facilities are quite good. Everything about this hotel is just above average. We paid 120 pounds including breakfast and, although not a bargain by any means, that is probably a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Not spectacular but a decent 4 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best feature are the floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the ocean (no view of Dubrovnik). It is a 15 minute walk to town and there is not shuttle bus.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon Destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a side note, I would recommend people not to stay in Dubrovnik but to visit for the day and stay up the coast. Dubrovnik is overpriced and food options are poor and (very) over priced. Dubrovnik is small and easy to visit in a day.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic hotel, and perfect service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel after weeks of looking through reviews/guidebooks etc and certainly made the perfect choice.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Bellevue for four nights as part of our honeymoon in Croatia. Bellevue really is a great hotel and I couldn't recommend it more. We arrived at the hotel and recieved a terrific welcome for our honeymoon including letter from the manager congratulating us and a complementary prosecco wine.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Service was very professional our entire stay.
reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The rooms and the entire hotel are nicely refurbished from a couple of years ago.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: - All the rooms have AMAZING VIEWS of the Adriatic. Wow.
reviews.title: Loved it and thrilled we stayed here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Walk to the old town is about 15 minutes, but not bad at all. Great location
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and even better location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won't bother parroting all of the other justifiably good reviews for the Hotel Bellevue in Dubrovnik. The location is scenic, it has a private beach, and the food is great. But I think special acknowledgment is due to the service. Our visit unfortunately coincided with three days of terrible weather in Dubrovnik which basically ruined our vacation, however that was no fault of the hotel and the hotel staff went out of their way to be courteous, helpful, and friendly to us. This couldn't have been easy for them since the hotel was full of other disappointed guests like us who'd dreamed of a relaxing, sunny holiday spent on the beach. Instead we were forced to seek shelter inside the hotel from a relentless rainstorm and the staff took on this burden. The restaurant was packed and the service was still commendable. The concierge was particularly helpful in connecting us with a rental car on very short notice and at a good price so my fiancee and I could day trip elsewhere in search of other entertainment.
reviews.title: Excellent service, but a little too far to walk to Old Town Dubrovnik

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, lovely rooms, fanstatic location (if a bit of a walk from the old town) overlooking the dramatic coast line. Elevator down to beach and beachside restaurant. Rooms were modern, clean and spacious with lovely luxury bathrooms.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel to make your trip feel extra special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff extremely friendly and helpful with fantastic breakfast of everything you could ever want! What a way to start the day!! Very comfortable beds. Balcony on the room meant sitting out sipping drinks watching the sunset turning the sea into liquid gold.
reviews.title: Super!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly reocommend the hotel, it's not cheap but I find more and more in life that you get what you pay for and it's worth the occasional indulgence!!
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

description: HOTEL BELLEVUE DUBROVNIK, one of Europe’s coolest new hotels according to the Sunday Times, is a unique hotel for discerning individual guests with an appreciation for luxury and attention to detail. The hotel is located in a spectacular 30 meter-high clifftop position overlooking the Adriatic, few minutes walking distance from the Old city of Dubrovnik. All 91 luxurious bedrooms and suites have sea views and are equipped with the latest technology.
